title: Bible Trivia for Seniors
description: Test your knowledge of the Old and New Testaments — famous verses, biblical characters, and timeless stories!

questions.question: How many days did it take God to create the world, according to Genesis?
questions.explanation: According to Genesis, God created the world in 6 days and rested on the 7th day.

questions.question: Who built the ark to save his family and animals from the Great Flood?
questions.explanation: Noah built the ark at God's command to survive the Great Flood, as told in Genesis chapters 6–9.

questions.question: What are the first four books of the New Testament collectively called?
questions.explanation: The first four books — Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John — are called the Gospels, meaning 'good news.'

questions.question: Who parted the Red Sea to lead the Israelites out of Egypt?
questions.explanation: Moses parted the Red Sea with God's power, allowing the Israelites to escape Pharaoh's army (Exodus 14).

questions.question: How many apostles did Jesus choose?
questions.explanation: Jesus chose 12 apostles, also called disciples, to be his closest followers and spread his teachings.

questions.question: Which book of the Bible contains the Ten Commandments?
questions.explanation: The Ten Commandments are first given in Exodus chapter 20, when God speaks to Moses on Mount Sinai.

questions.question: What is the shortest verse in the Bible?
questions.explanation: 'Jesus wept' (John 11:35) is the shortest verse in the King James Bible, just two words long.

questions.question: Who was swallowed by a great fish and lived inside it for three days?
questions.explanation: Jonah was swallowed by a great fish (often called a whale) after trying to flee from God's command to preach in Nineveh.

questions.question: In the parable of the Good Samaritan, who first passed by the injured man without helping?
options: A merchant and a tax collector
questions.explanation: In Luke 10:25–37, a priest and a Levite both passed by the injured man before the Samaritan stopped to help.

questions.question: How many books are in the Bible (Protestant canon)?
questions.explanation: The Protestant Bible contains 66 books — 39 in the Old Testament and 27 in the New Testament.

questions.question: Which giant did the young David defeat with a sling and a stone?
questions.explanation: David defeated the Philistine giant Goliath with a single stone from his sling, as told in 1 Samuel 17.

questions.question: What gift did the Magi NOT bring to the baby Jesus?
questions.explanation: The three Magi brought gold, frankincense, and myrrh (Matthew 2:11). Silver was not among the gifts.

questions.question: On which mountain did Moses receive the Ten Commandments?
questions.explanation: Moses received the Ten Commandments on Mount Sinai, also known as Mount Horeb, in the Sinai Peninsula.

questions.question: Which apostle is known for denying Jesus three times before the rooster crowed?
questions.explanation: Peter denied knowing Jesus three times on the night of his arrest, just as Jesus had predicted (Luke 22:54–62).

questions.question: What is the last book of the Bible?
questions.explanation: Revelation (also called the Apocalypse) is the last book of the Bible, written by the Apostle John.
